statement.p:
Leanne is sailing 3 miles west and 5 miles south of the harbor. She heads directly towards an island that is 8 miles west and 7 miles north of the harbor.
How far is Leanne from the island?
How far will Leanne be from the harbor when she is halfway to the island?

Dominic is 100 meters east and 250 meters north of Kristy. He is walking directly towards a tree that is 220 meters east and 90 meters north of Kristy.
How far is Dominic from the tree?
How far will Dominic be from the Kristy when he is halfway to the tree?

In the figure, M(\overline{x},\overline{y}) is the midpoint of the line segment \overline{AB}.
Using similar triangles, show that \amp AC=2AE\amp\amp\text{and}\amp\amp BC=2BD (You may assume that \angle ACB, \angle MDB, and \angle AEM are right angles.)

answer.p: MD \parallel AC, therefore \angle BAC=\angle BMD and \triangle BAC \sim \triangle MAE \sim \triangle BMD. Hence \dfrac{AB}{AM}=\dfrac{AC}{AE}. Since M is the midpoint of AB,~AB=2AM. Therefore, AC=2AE as well. Similarly, \dfrac{AB}{MB}=\dfrac{BC}{BD}. Hence BC=2BD.
